content:
• Tuesday, February 26, 2013
  • BGFV

    More on Big 5 Sporting Goods (NASDAQ:BGFV): Q4 beats on both counts as the sporting goods...

    More on Big 5 Sporting Goods (NASDAQ:BGFV): Q4 beats on both counts as the sporting goods retailer swung to a profit on better revenue and an absence of impairment charges that hurt year-earlier results. The company also provided upbeat earnings guidance for Q1 and raised its dividend. It now projects earnings between $0.18 and $0.24 per share, above the $0.08 Street estimate. It also projects Q1 same store sales in the positive high single-digit range. Shares +7.9% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:19 PM
  • GWRE

    Guidewire (NYSE:GWRE) guides on its FQ2 call for FY13 revenue of $286M-$292M. That's better than...

    Guidewire (NYSE:GWRE) guides on its FQ2 call for FY13 revenue of $286M-$292M. That's better than prior guidance of $279M-$289M, and above a consensus of $284.8M. Shares +14.8% AH and now just $2 away from their post-IPO high.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:38 PM
  • MNK

    More on Questcor Pharmaceuticals (QCOR): Q4 beats on all counts as total revenue jumped 113%...

    More on Questcor Pharmaceuticals (QCOR): Q4 beats on all counts as total revenue jumped 113% Y/Y, primarily due to expanded Acthar prescriptions in the treatment of nephrotic syndrome as well as the treatment of MS relapses and infantile spasms. Net sales also benefited from the initiation of commercial activities focused on the use of Acthar in the treatment of rheumatology-related conditions. Despite the overall better numbers, the shares are -6.6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:11 PM | 11 Comments
  • MERU

    Meru Networks (NASDAQ:MERU) -9.3% AH after announcing a public stock offering of undisclosed...

    Meru Networks (NASDAQ:MERU) -9.3% AH after announcing a public stock offering of undisclosed size. Shares of the enterprise Wi-Fi hardware equipment maker had staged a nice rally in recent months. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:11 PM
  • ZNGA

    Zynga (NASDAQ:ZNGA) +3% AH and Boyd (NYSE:BYD) +3.5% after NJ Gov. Chris Christie does the...

    Zynga (NASDAQ:ZNGA) +3% AH and Boyd (NYSE:BYD) +3.5% after NJ Gov. Chris Christie does the expected and signs an online gambling bill approved by the state legislature. The law only allows Atlantic City casinos to handle online bets within the state, but casino operators are expected to form partnerships with online gambling firms. Both NJ and Nevada are looking to sign deals that would allow local players to take bets from outside the state, but those agreements could take time to hammer out.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:03 PM | 5 Comments
  • TTTM

    T3 Motion (NYSEMKT:TTTM) announces that its CEO Rod Keller has tendered his resignation....

    T3 Motion (NYSEMKT:TTTM) announces that its CEO Rod Keller has tendered his resignation. The Board names William Tsumpes, a member of the Board of Directors, as the company's new Chief Executive. Both changes are effective immediately. Shares -4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:57 PM
  • GWRE

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: GWRE +9%. BGFV +8%. UVXY +5%. ZAGG +5%. TVIX +4%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: GWRE +9%. BGFV +8%. UVXY +5%. ZAGG +5%. TVIX +4%.
    After-hours top losers: FSLR -10%. AH -10%. MERU -9%. QCOR -6%. SPWR -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:51 PM | 3 Comments
  • UNXL

    More on UniPixel: Q1 guidance is for revenue of $5M, in-line with consensus. Company targeting...

    More on UniPixel: Q1 guidance is for revenue of $5M, in-line with consensus. Company targeting UniBoss touchscreen film production of 60K square feet/month by end of April, 200K by end of June, 700K by end of September, and 1.3M by Jan. '14. Opex rose 5% in 2012 to $9.1M - $5.1M spent on R&D, $4M on SG&A. UNXL +6.4% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:42 PM | 1 Comment
  • RCM

    Accretive Health (AH) says it will postpone the release of its financial results for Q4 and...

    Accretive Health (AH) says it will postpone the release of its financial results for Q4 and FY12, as well as its previously announced investor conference call scheduled for February 27. The company is reviewing the manner in which it recognizes revenue for its revenue cycle management agreements, and based on information available to date, if a change becomes necessary, it may be required to restate prior-period financial statements. Shares -9.6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:39 PM
  • SPWR

    A few solar stocks are adding to the losses they saw in regular trading (TAN -1.2%), thanks to...

    A few solar stocks are adding to the losses they saw in regular trading (TAN -1.2%), thanks to First Solar's top-line miss and light Q1 guidance. Much of the selling involves U.S. names. SPWR -4.8% AH. WFR -2.9%. SCTY -2.3%. JASO -1.8%. (more on FSLR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:32 PM
  • UNXL

    UniPixel (NASDAQ:UNXL): Q4 EPS of -$1.11 in-line. Revenue of $76.2K misses by $44K. Shares +8.3%...

    UniPixel (NASDAQ:UNXL): Q4 EPS of -$1.11 in-line. Revenue of $76.2K misses by $44K. Shares +8.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:25 PM
  • EIX

    More on Edison International (NYSE:EIX): Q4 beats across the board on narrower losses as the...

    More on Edison International (NYSE:EIX): Q4 beats across the board on narrower losses as the company's Southern California Edison utility posted stronger results. Total operating revenue grew by 22% Y/Y, while perating costs rose 11%. For FY13, the company forecast core earnings of $3.45 to $3.65 per share, compared with Street expectations of $3.28. Shares +3.5% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:19 PM
  • GA

    Giant Interactive (NYSE:GA): Q4 EPS of $0.23 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $91.8M (+15.5% Y/Y)...

    Giant Interactive (NYSE:GA): Q4 EPS of $0.23 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $91.8M (+15.5% Y/Y) beats by $0.84M. Shares +5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:02 PM
  • MAKO

    More on Mako Surgical (NASDAQ:MAKO): Q4 misses across the board on an 8% decline in total sales...

    More on Mako Surgical (NASDAQ:MAKO): Q4 misses across the board on an 8% decline in total sales Y/Y. For FY13, the company anticipates selling 45 to 48 RIO systems, versus a total of 45 RIO systems sold worldwide in 2012, and estimates its customers will perform 13,500 to 14,500 MAKOplasty procedures, versus 10,204 procedures performed in 2012. Shares +4.5 % AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:02 PM | 3 Comments
  • BBY

    Best Buy (BBY -3.2%) -1.3% AH, adding to the day's losses, after 5 sources tell Reuters Richard...

    Best Buy (BBY -3.2%) -1.3% AH, adding to the day's losses, after 5 sources tell Reuters Richard Schulze's buyout attempt is in jeopardy thanks to financing issues. Schulze is now said to be focused on a minority investment, one that could a PIPE transaction, but investors are said to remain hesitant. Talks with P-E firms Leonard Green, Cerberus, and TPG have reportedly made little progress. Schulze is facing a Thursday deadline to deliver a buyout proposal. (Feb. 13 WSJ report) Update: Best Buy has pushed back its FQ4 report by a day to March 1 to if Schulze makes a bid.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:48 PM | 8 Comments
  • RDN

    Radian Group (NYSE:RDN) is likely to move up the date of its capital raise to this evening from...

    Radian Group (NYSE:RDN) is likely to move up the date of its capital raise to this evening from after the close Wednesday, Morgan Stanley and Goldman Sachs have informed investors. The move highlights investor demand for the equity and convertible debt of the insurer (trading at 1.4x book). Radian will use the capital to backstop underwriting of new mortgage insurance.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:35 PM
  • JAZZ

    More on Jazz Pharma (NASDAQ:JAZZ): Q4 EPS easily beats estimates. Net sales of Xyrem were...

    More on Jazz Pharma (NASDAQ:JAZZ): Q4 EPS easily beats estimates. Net sales of Xyrem were $113.5M, compared to net sales of $71.8M for Q411. Gross margin was 85.8% compared to 95.2% for 2011. For FY13, the company expects an EPS of $5.70-5.90 on sales of $805M - 835M, above Street estimates of $5.67 on revenue of $811.3M. Shares +2% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:35 PM
  • NUVA

    NuVasive (NASDAQ:NUVA): Q4 EPS of $0.34 beats by $0.13. Revenue of $165.8M (+10.4% Y/Y) beats by...

    NuVasive (NASDAQ:NUVA): Q4 EPS of $0.34 beats by $0.13. Revenue of $165.8M (+10.4% Y/Y) beats by $9.45M. Shares +3.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM
  • GWRE

    Guidewire Software (NYSE:GWRE): FQ2 EPS of $0.21 beats by $0.19. Revenue of $72.2M (+31% Y/Y)...

    Guidewire Software (NYSE:GWRE): FQ2 EPS of $0.21 beats by $0.19. Revenue of $72.2M (+31% Y/Y) beats by $7.94M. Shares +6.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM
  • ZAGG

    Zagg (NASDAQ:ZAGG): Q3 EPS of $0.37 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $87.5M (+30% Y/Y) beats by $3.9M....

    Zagg (NASDAQ:ZAGG): Q3 EPS of $0.37 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $87.5M (+30% Y/Y) beats by $3.9M. Guidance for 2013 is set at $313M to $318M for revenue and adjusted EBITDA of $69M to $71M. Shares +6.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM | 2 Comments
  • FSLR

    First Solar (NASDAQ:FSLR): Q4 EPS of $2.04 beats by $0.28. Revenue of $1.08B (+63% Y/Y) misses...

    First Solar (NASDAQ:FSLR): Q4 EPS of $2.04 beats by $0.28. Revenue of $1.08B (+63% Y/Y) misses by $240M. Expects Q1 revenue of $650M-$750M and EPS of $0.70-$0.90, below consensus of $829M and $0.94. Shares -5.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM
  • BKNG

    Priceline (PCLN): Q4 EPS of $6.77 beats by $0.23. Revenue of $1.19B (+20% Y/Y). Shares +4.5% AH....

    Priceline (PCLN): Q4 EPS of $6.77 beats by $0.23. Revenue of $1.19B (+20% Y/Y). Shares +4.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM
  • BDBD

    RBC Capital defends Boulder Brands (BDBD -15.4%) after a negative report from Prescience Point...

    RBC Capital defends Boulder Brands (BDBD -15.4%) after a negative report from Prescience Point helps to drive shares of the food company lower. The firm thinks the major points brought up by the short seller are either dated or overstated and it backs management as straight shooters. Boulder Brands will be back in focus on Thursday when it reports earnings.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • BAM

    Shares of GrafTech International (GTI -6.5%) are poised to close in the red today the company...

    Shares of GrafTech International (GTI -6.5%) are poised to close in the red today the company reported Q4 results that beat estimates, but posted a 19% Y/Y decline in total sales. Analysts appear to have a more negative outlook for the upcoming quarter'a performance. Over the past three months, the average estimate for next quarter's earnings has fallen from a profit of $0.21 to a profit $0.15. For the current year, the average estimate has moved down from a profit of $0.78 to a profit of $0.77 over the last ninety days.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:52 PM
  • SRE

    Sempra Energy (SRE +1.8%) expects to get federal permission to build facilities to export...

    Sempra Energy (SRE +1.8%) expects to get federal permission to build facilities to export natural gas in Louisiana, and will be ready to start construction in early 2014 en route to a late-2017 start of operations, CEO Debra Reed says. The export terminal is designed to export as much as 12M tons/year of natural gas, and is estimated to cost $6B-$7B.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:27 PM
  • EQC

    CommonWealth REIT (CWH +47%) continues adding to opening gains after two investors disclosed a...

    CommonWealth REIT (CWH +47%) continues adding to opening gains after two investors disclosed a near-10% stake and said they were prepared to buy the whole company. The investors have asked the company to refrain from a planned secondary of shares and debt tender while they enter into discussions.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:54 PM | 1 Comment
  • URS

    Shares of URS (URS +2.8%) move up today on a narrow Q4 earnings beat. Net profit more than...

    Shares of URS (URS +2.8%) move up today on a narrow Q4 earnings beat. Net profit more than doubled as a recent acquisition helped boost the construction and engineering company's revenue and last years results were weighed down by a write-down. The company on Monday also raised its quarterly dividend 5% to 21 cents a share, and said FY13 EPS estimates would bracket the Street consensus.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:41 PM
  • EGI

    Entree Gold (EGI -9.2%) shares slump after Mongolia’s mining ministry reportedly cancels...

    Entree Gold (EGI -9.2%) shares slump after Mongolia’s mining ministry reportedly cancels two licenses on land that forms part of the Oyu Tolgoi deposit. EGI says it has not received formal notification from an government agency. Shares of Turquoise Hill Resources (TRQ -1.8%), which is developing Oyu Tolgoi, also drop.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM | 3 Comments
  • SLCA

    U.S. Silica (SLCA +18.7%) soars after its Q4 earnings beat was driven by higher than expected...

    U.S. Silica (SLCA +18.7%) soars after its Q4 earnings beat was driven by higher than expected revenues and operating income from its oil and gas segment. Overall sales volumes increased to 1.8M tons, up 10% Y/Y. Contribution margin of $50.5M was up 32% Y/Y. Expects Q1 revenues of $115M-123M vs. $114.2M consensus.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:18 PM
  • AAPL

    "High above the Alps my Gnome is hearing a rumor that Apple will announce a stock split at...

    "High above the Alps my Gnome is hearing a rumor that Apple will announce a stock split at tomorrow's shareholder meeting," tweets Doug Kass. The rumor has led Apple (AAPL +1%) shares to spike higher. Update (2:24 PM): Kass is using the post-rumor spike to sell part of his trading position in Apple.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:54 PM | 72 Comments
  • AMT

    A top-line beat and solid guidance are helping American Tower (AMT +2.1%) outperform following...

    A top-line beat and solid guidance are helping American Tower (AMT +2.1%) outperform following its Q4 report, in spite of an EPS miss. The cell tower owner expects 2013 revenue of $3.16B-$3.21B, in-line with a $3.19B consensus. AFFO is expected to total $1.36B-$1.41B - that represents 15.6% growth at the midpoint - and capex is seen amounting to $550M-$650M vs. $568M in 2012. AMT, which finished 2012 owning 54.K cell sites (22.5K in the U.S.), plans to build 2,250-2,750 more in 2013. (PR) (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:49 PM
  • UTHR

    After a valliant fight, United Therapeutics (UTHR -0.9%) gives up the days gains to trade in the...

    After a valliant fight, United Therapeutics (UTHR -0.9%) gives up the days gains to trade in the red after Brean Murray cuts the shares to Hold on the back of its Q4 results posted earlier. The stock has had a good run since plummeting in October of last year on the FDA's rejection of Treprostinil, gaining nearly 30% and presently testing a 2-year high.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:26 PM
  • AAPL

    The DoD will open its networks to iOS (NASDAQ:AAPL) and Android (NASDAQ:GOOG) devices in Feb....

    The DoD will open its networks to iOS (NASDAQ:AAPL) and Android (NASDAQ:GOOG) devices in Feb. 2014, as part of an effort to develop a "platform agnostic" device policy. That's a negative for BlackBerry (BBRY -3.7%), which currently accounts for 470K of the 600K mobile devices deployed by the DoD, and could be contributing to today's weakness. The DoD, which issued security guidelines for iOS/Android gear last year, adds it's looking to support BB10. (Home Depot)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:24 PM | 26 Comments
  • AMAT

    Goldman makes Applied Materials (AMAT +2.3%) a Conviction Buy on news of Bob Halliday's...

    Goldman makes Applied Materials (AMAT +2.3%) a Conviction Buy on news of Bob Halliday's promotion to CFO. Halliday and (AMAT president/former Varian CEO) Gary Dickerson were crucial to more than doubling Varian's share of the implantation equipment market in the 7 years prior to its purchase by AMAT, Goldman observes. It thinks Halliday's track record "bodes well for Applied's ability to execute on a more streamlined cost structure," and to gain chip equipment share.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:06 PM
  • MNOV

    Midday top 10 gainers: MNOV +54%. RNIN +45%. CWH +31%. SLCA +22%. ALC-OLD +22%. NOAH +16%. GMXR...

    Midday top 10 gainers: MNOV +54%. RNIN +45%. CWH +31%. SLCA +22%. ALC-OLD +22%. NOAH +16%. GMXR +14%. PRPH +13%. EMITF +13%. FLML +12%.
    Midday top 10 losers: FSGI -25%. HSII -20%. VRTB -19%. VSI -18%. TWI -16%. SSP -13%. ENMD -12%. VVUS -12%. VIPS -10%. CHMT -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • CHMT

    Chemtura (CHMT -10.5%) shares plunge after the maker of specialty chemicals is downgraded at...

    Chemtura (CHMT -10.5%) shares plunge after the maker of specialty chemicals is downgraded at Oppenheimer, which says Q4 results showed CHMT may be approaching the limits to further margin improvement without a healthier economy. Also, legacy overhead costs from its antioxidants sale will hamper margins, and 2013 capex needs are higher than expected.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:31 PM
  • BDBD

    Boulder Brands (BDBD -7.8%) could see a sharp drop in value with its financial condition...

    Boulder Brands (BDBD -7.8%) could see a sharp drop in value with its financial condition weakening, warns SA contributor Prescience Point. Shares are overvalued compared to food sector peers and the gluten-free story isn't playing out like management trumpeted, says the short-selling firm. If the call is right, then Mario Gabelli will be quite wrong after he named Boulder Brands one of his 10 favorite stocks for 2013. (Prescience Point's full report .pdf)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM | 1 Comment
  • OKE

    ONEOK Partners (OKS -4.4%) drops sharply after Credit Suisse downgrades OKS to Neutral and cut...

    ONEOK Partners (OKS -4.4%) drops sharply after Credit Suisse downgrades OKS to Neutral and cut its target price to $58 from $67. OKS will have $4B-plus of fee-based projects placed in service over the next three years, but CS says it is a victim of weak natural gas liquids prices and collapsing spreads, undercutting prospects. Distribution growth/unit was cut by 850bp, to 2.8%, for 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:21 PM | 2 Comments
  • ATML

    A downgrade to Market Perform from FBR is pressuring Atmel (ATML -2.3%) shares. The firm is...

    A downgrade to Market Perform from FBR is pressuring Atmel (ATML -2.3%) shares. The firm is worried about valuation and soft PC touchscreen controller sales - sales of touch-enabled Windows 8 hardware have underwhelmed thus far, but Microsoft, Intel, and OEMs are committed to growing penetration rates. Rival Cypress (CY +2.4%), which just announced its controllers are used in the 2013 Toyota Avalon, is heading in the opposite direction. Update: FBR is also worried about a transition to cheaper, single-chip, PC touch controller solutions, and Atmel's lack of an in-cell controller.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:07 PM
  • CVRR

    Coverage of CVR Refining (CVRR -4.1%) is initiated with mostly middling recommendations by...

    Coverage of CVR Refining (CVRR -4.1%) is initiated with mostly middling recommendations by at least four sell-side firms: an Equal Weight at Barclays, a Neutral at Credit Suisse, a Neutral at Citigroup, and a Buy at UBS. CVRR's profitability is leveraged to operations of just two assets: its 115M bbl/day Coffeyville, Kan., and 70M bbl/day Wynnewood, Okla., refineries.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM
  • USNA

    Usana Health Sciences (USNA -1.6%) slips today, despite its announcement that its China...

    Usana Health Sciences (USNA -1.6%) slips today, despite its announcement that its China subsidiary BabyCare Ltd. has been given the official government stamp of approval from the People's Republic of China to expand direct selling activities in 3 additional provinces; Jiangsu, Shanxi and Tianjin.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:51 AM
  • FXEN

    FX Energy (FXEN -3.2%) says the drill stem test at its Tuchola-3K well failed to encounter any...

    FX Energy (FXEN -3.2%) says the drill stem test at its Tuchola-3K well failed to encounter any inflow of gas or fluid. FXEN says portions of the reservoir are cemented while other portions are porous and permeable; "clearly the Main Dolomite is gas charged and a nearby area with better reservoir properties should yield favorable results."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM
  • HUM

    Humana (HUM -2.3%) says its CFO James Bloem will retire at the end of the year, prompting the...

    Humana (HUM -2.3%) says its CFO James Bloem will retire at the end of the year, prompting the health insurer to launch an internal and external search for his successor. Jefferies says the move comes at a challenging time for the company, and Bloem's successor is stepping into a difficult role, which could raise some concerns. It's only been a year since Bruce Broussard took the reins as CEO, and with worries over lower Medicare Advantage rates next year, the announcement "adds more uncertainty to management's ability to navigate the rate headwinds," Jefferies says.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM
  • QIHU

    A month after Qihoo's (QIHU -3.7%) iOS apps were banned from the App Store due to policy...

    A month after Qihoo's (QIHU -3.7%) iOS apps were banned from the App Store due to policy violations, the company is reportedly thinking of abandoning the App Store. A Qihoo exec sent to Apple HQ to smooth things over "was not granted an audience," Marbridge Consulting reports, and most of Qihoo's mobile users (in-line with Chinese smartphone trends) rely on Android. However, iPhone users are a wealthier demographic, and still a sizable portion of the market. Qihoo -6.4% over the last 2 days.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:15 AM
  • TWI

    Titan International (TWI -17.8%) gets hammered after its Q4 missed the mark late yesterday. Net...

    Titan International (TWI -17.8%) gets hammered after its Q4 missed the mark late yesterday. Net earnings swung to a loss as the tire makers results were hurt by a number of factors, including a larger tax provision, a slowdown in construction in Europe which negatively impacted its newly acquired Titan Europe business, as well as extra costs for starting up a wheel facility after an earthquake in Italy.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:06 AM | 1 Comment
  • TSL

    Up slightly at the open following a mixed Q4 report, Trina (TSL -8.1%) is now selling off;...

    Up slightly at the open following a mixed Q4 report, Trina (TSL -8.1%) is now selling off; shares are still up over 2x from their Nov. bottom, but down 21% from their Feb. 14 close. Trina is guiding for Q1 module shipments of 420MW-430MW, up from 415MW in Q4 and 380MW in Q3. 2013 guidance is for module shipments of 2GW-2.1GW, up from 2012's 1.59GW. While Q4 module shipments beat estimates, weak pricing resulted in a gross margin of just 1.9%, though that's better than Q3's 0.8%. Opex -19% Y/Y, but still up as a % of revenue. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM
  • COL

    BE Aerospace (BEAV +1.7%) gets a bump higher on positive comments out of Goldman Sachs this...

    BE Aerospace (BEAV +1.7%) gets a bump higher on positive comments out of Goldman Sachs this morning following its recent investor day, calling it the best story in aerospace. The firm cites company-specific drivers - like higher margins out of its Business Jet unit - plus the potential for an upside surprise to earnings. It reiterates its Conviction Buy rating, ups its price target from $67 to $68, and raises FY13/14/15 estimates to $3.46/$4.46/$5.37 respectively. Read more on its Investor Day here: Investor Day Transcript.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM
  • WDC

    SanDisk's (SNDK +2.5%) transformation into a vertically integrated flash memory solutions...

    SanDisk's (SNDK +2.5%) transformation into a vertically integrated flash memory solutions provider for OEMs (as compared with its past reputation as a retail flash memory card supplier) is going over well with RBC, which is upgrading shares to Buy and lifting its PT to $65 from $50. Shares are now within $2 of their 52-week high of $52.58. CFO Judy Bruner presents at a Morgan Stanley conference at 12:30PM ET (webcast). (Nvidia partnership)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM | 2 Comments
  • SPRD

    More on Spreadtrum: Q1 guidance is for revenue of $180M-$186M, above a $171.6M consensus. Q4...

    More on Spreadtrum: Q1 guidance is for revenue of $180M-$186M, above a $171.6M consensus. Q4 gross margin was 37.2%, -20 bps Q/Q and -370 bps Y/Y. Opex +11% Y/Y, higher than revenue growth. Over half of Q4 revenue came from smartphone chip shipments. Dual-core 3G TD-SCDMA baseband/app processor (needed to compete against MediaTek and Qualcomm) expected to begin shipping in phones "in very near future." Company plans to roll out 3G W-CDMA and 4G LTE baseband chips (larger markets, but more competition) this year. SPRD +2.5%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:49 AM
  • NBL

    Prior to the management shakeup, Miller Tabak had downgraded Rosetta Resources (ROSE -6.4%) to...

    Prior to the management shakeup, Miller Tabak had downgraded Rosetta Resources (ROSE -6.4%) to Sell from Hold, citing a short-term spike in oil production at the Eagle Ford's Karnes Trough which should peak in Q1. Without an acquisition of more oil acreage, the firm says ROSE will be forced to focus on its acreage in liquids amid continued weakness in NGL and natural gas pricing.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:39 AM
  • NBL

    Rosetta Resources (NASDAQ:ROSE) -5% premarket after a shakeup at the top. Randy Limbacher is...

    Rosetta Resources (NASDAQ:ROSE) -5% premarket after a shakeup at the top. Randy Limbacher is resigning as Chairman, CEO and President, to be replaced by James Craddock, senior VP for drilling and production operations. John Clayton, senior VP for asset development, is the new COO.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM
  • SLCA

    U.S. Silica Holdings (NYSE:SLCA): Q4 EPS of $0.41. Revenue of $118.8M (+42% Y/Y) beats by $10M....

Spanish 10-year yields feed off the anxiety to rise 9 bps to 5.26%.
